data.title: IndianaStateUSBC.org – Indiana State USBC
data.text:
Search

Mission Statement

Work with other bowling organizations to Promote the Sport of Bowling by Providing Programs, Events and Services to the USBC Associations and USBC members along with non-bowling events or functions within the State.

Indiana State USBC Vision Statement

The vision of the Indiana State USBC is to provide Leadership Opportunities and Quality Services that will enhance Bowling Experiences, Stimulate Growth and prepare its members for the Future of the Sport.

2023-24 BOARD of DIRECTORS with STAFF

President Bill Kendall, Association Manager Brian Nunning, Assistant Association Manager Rick Schultz, Southwest Regional Director Tiffany Friars, District 5 Director Jenni Ferguson, 2nd Vice PresidentJerry Grochowski, 1st Vice President Lynda Isaacs, District 7 Director Charles Rott, Northwest Regional Director Martha Vazquez-Boezeman, District 8 Director Paul LeMond, District 6 Director Dee Johnson, Southeast Regional Director Corky Koch, District 4 Director Kim Davis, Mike Hanna, District 3 Director Donna Dennie,District 9 Director Mike McPherson, Northeast Regional Director Mikayla Schram, Scratch Tournaments Manager Jeff Circle, Director District 2 Director Justin Hauser.

2022-23 BOARD and STAFF

Seated: Mikayla Schram, Tiffany Friars, Jenni Ferguson, Donna Dennie, Former President Alice ‘AJ’ Hacker, Brian Nunning, Dee Johnson, Rick Schultz, Corky Koch, Lynda Isaacs. Standing: Dale Bennington, Mike McPherson,Charles ‘Chip’ Rott, President Bill Kendall, Kim Davis, Tony Peterson, Jerry Grochowski, Jeff Circle, Justin Hauser, and Brian Petrey. Absent: Paul LeMond, Angie Kendall.

IS USBC Request For Proposals (RFP)

for the 2025-2026 Tournament Season

Indiana State USBC Request for Proposal (RFP) – Fillable

Complete then Print

Indiana State USBC Request for Proposal(RFP) –

Print then complete

Deadline: May 8, 2024

The RFP’s provided above are for all tournaments to be submitted with one process – for one or all tournaments that you may want to host.

After completing the RFP, scan it into your pc with all signed and relevant supportive documentation.

Tournaments included with this RFP package are:

2025 IS USBC Mixed Championship

2026 IS USBC Youth Championship

2026 IS USBC Women’s Championship

2026 IS USBC Seniors Championship

2026 IS USBC Open Championship

2026 Indiana State Pepsi Championship

To utilize all aspects of the

Adobe Acrobat / PDF fillable forms

THEY MUST BE COMPLETED WITH THE

ADOBE PROGRAM OR THE ADOBE READER (Reader free download here)

To save a copy of your Adobe (.pdf) completed form(s) on your computer:

You must use the Adobe Reader (free) or Acrobat Program to open and edit (Click here for Free Acrobat Adobe Reader)

It is to your advantage to be sure that you have a current version of the FREE Adobe Reader that is easily downloaded from link above

Save the form on your computer with a unique name such as “yourname_2021entry.pdf”

Open that file (“yourname_2021entry.pdf”) on your computer

Fill it out, then save again—you must open the file you saved; do not try to complete the entry form from the website if you want to save a copy to your computer

To test to be sure that it is saving correctly, put your name in, save it, and reopen

ADOBE READER

Names should be submitted by the

Association Manager or

designated Contact Person.

To avoid any misinformation when submitting a name for the Memorial Page, our policy is to include a link of the obituary to the webmaster at the time of submission.

A butterfly lights beside us like a sunbeam, and for a brief moment, its Glory and beauty belong to our world, then it flies on again. And though we wish it could have stayed, we feel so blessed to have seen it.” —Unknown
